bizikleta.text: From Bordeaux to San Sebastian on the Atlantic West Route to visit the Basque country

indonesia.text: 3 weeks in Indonesia, between Java & Bali

japan.text: 20 days of island-hopping in the southern islands of japan between beach and jungle.

story.6: This is my first contact with Japan, and even if you can find traditional Japanese style buildings,
story.7: what strikes to me the most is that the city is mainly made of square concrete buildings, designed to withstand typhoons
story.15: The Shƒ´sƒÅ, half lion, half dog, they protect the houses against the evil spirits
story.16: the pace of life is very calm here, far from the image I had of Japanese cities
story.18: We find this kind of dispensers everywhere..
story.29: Ishigaki-jima, the town of Ishigaki is not very interesting in itself, but from the port you can reach the different islands nearby
story.35: 20 minutes by boat from the port of Ishigaki is a tiny island mostly occupied by a small village,
story.37: whose houses are typical of the Kingdom of Ry≈´ky≈´ and the walls which line the roads, made of coral, here there are no modern buildings
story.43: The vast majority of the surface of this island is wild, covered with mangroves, a dense jungle and mountains so I stayed there for several days
story.45: it is possible to go up the rivers in Kayak to go explore the forests
story.51: Being very far from Japan, and having only one road, the inhabitants worried that their children did not have the red lights reflex. To teach them, they had two red lights installed on the road, one just outside the main pier, the other near the school.
story.57: This farmer, quite surprised by my presence on his island, did not hesitate to make me taste the local sake, the Awamori ... several times
story.63: Not far from Naha, but much less developed the Kerama Islands are known for their calm beaches with very blue water
story.79: The island is covered with a very dense forest, with high mountains that catch the clouds, which gives it a mystical atmosphere
story.87: She is mainly known for having inspired the sets for the film "Princesse Mononok√©"
story.96: The relief makes that we pass quickly from 0 to 1800m of altitude and when we arrive at the top, if we are lucky, the view is clear and we can see the whole island at 360 degrees
story.97: and going back down, dive into a waterfall to cool off, or go and relax in an Onsen

nepal.text: Two weeks in the Kathmandu valley to soak up the Nepalese culture before going to the mountains

story.5: Second destination, Nepal with an atmosphere very different from Japan
story.7: with the goal of visiting some of Kathmandu valley to absorb the Nepalese culture before heading into the mountains
story.14: the valley suffered a lot from earthquakes in 2015, many buildings are still quirky

annapurna.text: 8 days of walking on one of the most legendary Himalayan treks surrounded by peaks sometimes reaching more than 8000 meters

story.1: Day 1 - After a full day of transport, bus + 4x4 from Kathmandu to Jagat, 8 days of walking begin on one of the most legendary treks of the Himalayas
story.8: Dal bhat, "lentil rice", one of the main dish we ate during the trek
story.13: The Nepalese style buildings are slowly replaced by Tibetan architecture
story.18: Day 3 - The famous "Nepali Flat": A little bit up, a little bit down!
story.21: And all of a sudden it looks like it's fall season
story.25: The size of the village is giving a nice scale of how big the moutains are here
story.32: A yak not in his natural habitat.
story.35: Day 5 - Rest day in Manang, the occasion to visit the village and to do some acclimation walks
story.40: The mountains above 6000 meters above sea level are so many that most of them have no name, only a number
story.42: Tishna, our cook, cooking breakfast and warming up at the same time
story.48: Day 8 - The main difficulty of the trek, Thorong-La Pass, a pass at 5414 meters above sea level. During his ascent, which begins in the night, the horses are there to help walkers struggling to reach the pass and walk to the opposite valley to continue their journey
story.53: A never ending day, after crossing the pass, we descend quickly to a less dangerous altitude, the snow is quickly replaced by sand and stones as far as the eye can see
story.57: Day 9 - Given the quality of the roads, the return to Kathmandu is via small cuckoos with propellers which fly at sight, here we had to make twice the journey because there was too much cloud the first time to land

thailand.text: Last stage of a two month trip in asia

story.1: Bangkok - Last step of the trip, a little tired and not really excited about the idea of still visiting temples üò¨, I decided to go to more unusual places
story.7: Not really easy to access, metro + bus + a railway line to cross on foot to access it, it's the largest museum of contemporary art in Asia and the building alone is worth it
story.15: Not very touristy and not very far from Bangkok, this is the last stage of the trip, Paddle, Nap and DIY with the owner of the hut and then it will be time to return to France ‚òπÔ∏è

istanbul.text: 4 days / 3 nights to visit a city on the border between the East and the West and bathed by the waters of the Bosphorus

myanmar.text: 18 days / 17 nights and a lot of night buses to travel around Myanmar

malaysia.text: 18 days / 17 nights to travel around Malaysia with voyatopia

kilimanjaro.text: 6 days / 4 nights of trekking in Tanzania to climb mount Kilimanjaro (5985m) by the Machame route

nepal.text: Deux semaine dans la vall√©e de Katmandou pour s'impr√©gner de la culture N√©palaise avant de partir dans les montagnes

story.5: Deuxi√®me destination, le N√©pal et une ambiance bien diff√©rente du Japon
story.7: avec comme but de visiter un peu la vall√©e de Katmandou pour s'impr√©gner de la culture N√©palaise avant de partir dans les montagnes
story.14: la vall√©e beaucoup souffert des s√©ismes en 2015, beaucoup de b√¢timents sont encore tout biscornus

story.1: Jour 1 - Apr√®s une journ√©e enti√®re de transport, bus + 4x4 depuis Kathmandu pour aller √† Jagat, 8 jours de marche commencent sur l'un des plus legendaire treks Himalayen
story.8: Dal bhat, "riz lentille", un des plats principal durant le trek, extr√™mement nourrissant üòÖ
story.13: Plus on avance et plus les b√¢timents de style n√©palais sont remplac√©s par l'architecture tib√©taine
story.18: Jour 3 - Le fameux "Plat N√©palais": √ßa monte ou √ßa descend
story.21: Et tout d'un coup on pourrait se croire en automne
story.25: La taille du village permet de se rendre compte de l'immensit√© des montagnes autour
story.32: Un yak dans son habitat naturel (non)
story.35: Jour 5 - Jour de repos √† Manang, l'occasion de visiter le village et de faire une marche d'acclimatation
story.40: Les montagnes d√©passant les 6000 m√®tres d‚Äôaltitudes sont tellement nombreuse que la plupart n‚Äôon pas de nom, seulement un num√©ro
story.42: Tishna, le cuisinier, en train de preparer le petit dej et se rechauffant en meme temps
story.48: Jour 8 - La principale difficult√© du trek, Thorong-La Pass, un col √† 5414 m√®tre d‚Äôaltitude. Durant son ascension, qui commence dans la nuit, des chevaux sont l√† pour aider les marcheurs en difficult√© √† atteindre le col, et rejoindre la vall√©e oppos√©e afin de continuer le trek
